description: Enterprise techniques used by Exaramel, ATT&CK software S0343 v1.0
name: Exaramel (S0343)

techniques.comment: Exaramel has a command to launch a remote shell and executes commands on the victim’s machine.
The Exaramel dropper creates and starts a Windows service named wsmprovav with the description “Windows Check AV” in an apparent attempt to masquerade as a legitimate service.
Exaramel adds the configuration to the Registry in XML format.
The Exaramel dropper creates and starts a Windows service named wsmprovav with the description “Windows Check AV”.
Exaramel uses RC4 for encrypting the configuration.
Exaramel has a command to download a file from a remote server to execute.
Exaramel has a command to execute VBS and GO scripts on the victim’s machine.
Exaramel checks for anti-virus software installed on the victim’s machine.
Exaramel uses HTTPS for C2 communications.
